jaron.uavsim
Class Autopilot

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      jaron.uavsim.Autopilot
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Autopilot
extends java.lang.Thread

The Autopilot class in its current state provides a simple PID controller that calculates the deflection of the elevator and aileron according to the pitch and roll degree.
The autopilot starts itself as a thread when instantiated and recalculates its data at a frequency of 5Hz.
By implementing the data as signals the autopilot can be a listener (e.g. pitch and roll input from FlightGear) and a notifier (e.g. aileron and elevator output to FlightGear).

Have a look at the example of the UAVsim for the usage of the Autopilot.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
jarontec gmail com

Method Detail

addAileronListener

public void addAileronListener(SignalListener listener)
Adds a listener to the aileron signal event handling. In case of a change of the autopilot's aileron value, its listeners are informed through the EventListener mechanism.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to be added
See Also:
SignalListener

addElevatorListener

public void addElevatorListener(SignalListener listener)

getPower

public Signal getPower()
Returns a reference to a Signal object containing a value that represents the current status of the autopilot. The stauts is either on (getSignal equals getHigh) or off (getSignal equals getLow).
In its off status the autopilot doesn't react on input actions.

Returns:
the current autopilot status
See Also:
Signal

getRoll

public Signal getRoll()
Returns a reference to a Signal object containing a value that represents the current roll in degrees.

Returns:
the current roll in degrees
See Also:
Signal
